definition: thick/deep or profound/kind/generous/rich or strong in flavor/to favor/to stress
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: Lavish gifts were bestowed on the visitors.
The bounteous largess given thee to give?
sentences.chinese: 那交給你轉交給別人的厚禮？

sentences.english: Thank you for the nice gift, but I can not accept it.
sentences.chinese: 感謝你的厚禮相送，可是我不能接受。

sentences.english: The gift of life, the original only reward for those willing to try on a person.
sentences.chinese: 生命的厚禮，原來只賞賜給那些肯於一嘗的人。

definition: the last of the three entry-level exams in the imperial examination system of Ming and Qing dynasties
full of youthful vigor (idiom)/in the prime of youth
Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
to judge between right and wrong/to reason things out
